Authors: Viana, JS; Bruno, RLA; Mendonca, JL; Goncalves, EP; Alves, EU; Braga , JM
Article Title: Precocity of soybean cultivars on cultivation systems with corn in Areia, Paraiba State
phen.trait.raw: emergence time; flowering time, time to maturation
reason/s for multiple directions of effe: effects varied by cultivar and by cropping system (mono vs. intercropping) and by trait; no effect on germination
Notes: also measured a period from the beginning of flower to mid-fruit which I could not define. i believe all traits were tested the same way, therefore absence of effect reported = n.s. Article in Portugese, used google translate

Authors: Liu, SJ; Guo, HL; Xu, J; Song, ZY; Song, SR; Tang, JJ; Chen, X
Article Title: Arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi differ in affecting the flowering of a host plant under two soil phosphorus conditions
treatment: with isolate and high soil P
reason/s for multiple directions of effe: dependent on high/low soil P
What fitness components?: flower number, fruit biomass, total biomass
Notes: inoculation sped up flowering and time to first fruit maturation, although some treatments did not flower or set fruit at all under low P conditions. measured fitness but no selection gradients/differentials reported. Good paper for effect of microbes on resource allocation.

Article Title: PLANT DEMOGRAPHIC RESPONSES TO MYCORRHIZAL SYMBIOSIS IN TALLGRASS PRAIRIE

Authors: SHUMWAY, DL; KOIDE, RT
Article Title: REPRODUCTIVE RESPONSES TO MYCORRHIZAL COLONIZATION OF ABUTILON-THEOPHRASTI MEDIC PLANTS GROWN FOR 2 GENERATIONS IN THE FIELD
treatment: one generation of mycorrhizal treatment; early seed treatment
What fitness components?: number of seed capsules; seed weight
Notes: AMF incoulation of MATERNAL PLANTS --> earlier flowering in offspring generation. Also AMF inoc of offspring generation --> earlier flowering in same generation. AMF inoc in offspring generation --> greater # of seed capsules + greater seed weight

Authors: Yguel, B; Courty, PE; Jactel, H; Pan, X; Butenschoen, O; Murray, PJ; Prinzing, A
Article Title: Mycorrhizae support oaks growing in a phylogenetically distant neighbourhood
reason/s for multiple directions of effe: continuous linear relationship between budburst and EMF enzymatic activity (more activity --> earlier budburst)
Notes: Phylogenetic isolation also delayed budburst but this effect was due to the dilution of oaks. Interestingly, the increase in EMf enzymatic activity appeared to partly compensate for the negative effect of phylogenetic isolation on budburst phenology.

Authors: Shykoff, JA; Kaltz, O
Article Title: Effects of the anther smut fungus Microbotryum violaceum on host life-history patterns in Silene latifolia (Caryophyllaceae)
second opinion note: all inoculated; but determined some inoculations were unsuccessful & compared between these
phen.trait.raw: flowering time seasonally; years to first flower event
treatment: males; data from fungus treatments pooled for males
reason/s for multiple directions of effe: more plants that flowered in the first season were diseased; males flowered later in season when diseased; females no change
What fitness components?: number of flowers -- but diseased plants are sterile
Notes: problem of that all were inoculated
column43: interesting discussion of why infection should favor earlier vs delayed reproduction

Authors: Cvjetkovic, B; Mataruga, M; Isajev, V; Levic, J; Lucic, A; Trkulja, V; Kremenovic, Z
Article Title: VARIABILITY IN GERMINATION AND GERMINATION DYNAMICS OF DIFFERENTLY TREATED SEEDS OF SERBIAN SPRUCE (PICEA OMORIKA PANCIC/PURKYNE)
second opinion note: this paper was really hard to understand - but I think I got the results
culture.vsother: direct (removal of naturally occurring with fungicide)
reason/s for multiple directions of effe: no differences in total amount of seeds germinating; untreated seeds germinated faster
Notes: lack of significance of treatment within population on the probability of germination isn't fully clear to me; but given super high variance of rates reported, I'm pretty sure

Article Title: Adaptive phenotypic divergence in an annual grass differs across biotic contexts
treatment: pop 1 (I named populations as they appear in plot); Biota 15.0

Notes: a link is argued to exist between biomass and total seed production in another subspecies of this annual plant
